person.persName: Samuel Haycraft (Hardin County County and Circuit Clerk, State Senator, attorney, and farmer)

body.p: Kentucky farmer, attorney, politician, and public servant. Educated in the country schools of Hardin County, Kentucky. Worked in the County and Circuit Clerk's office under Major Ben Helm from 1809 to 1816. Married to Sarah Brown Helm Haycraft, daughter of John L. Helm.Father of Edward Helm Haycraft, Sarah Maria Haycraft McMurtry, John Samuel Haycraft, Louisa Ann Haycraft, Margaret John Haycraft Poston, and Eliza A. Haycraft. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Appointed and served as clerk of the Hardin County and Circuit Court from 1816 to 1851. Member of the Baptist Church and became a deacon in 1835. Served as a Trustee of Georgetown College. Practiced law in Elizabethtown, Kentucky from 1851 to 1855. Again, served as clerk of the Hardin County and Circuit Court from 1855 to 1857. Returned to the practice of law in 1857. Elected and served as a member of the Kentucky State Senate from 1858 to 1862. Again served as clerk of the Hardin County and Circuit Court from 1862 to 1868.
